item.title: Report X-2025041732
item.description:
Report X-2025041732

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 16, 2025, Hub personnel reported that unit RNLU 100108 was leaking a blue liquid that had seeped through the container floor, resulting in a spill of less than 1 gallon of product onto the ground. An interior inspection of the cargo inside revealed a mixed load of hazardous materials palletized and (Printer Ink) in 55 gallon drum on the floor of the container towards the rear of the container. The pallets were stowed two rows wide, stacked two high. The load was secured using a 4x4 foot piece of lumber nailed into a 40"x48" pallet at the rear of the container. A 55 gallon drum containing printer ink, classified as a Class 3 Flammable Hazardous Material, was discovered leaking inside a container positioned on railcar FEC 72198. Upon inspection, it was determined that approximately 25 gallons of ink had been released inside the container and onto the interior of the railcar. Further examination of the drum revealed two cracks at the bottom, which were identified as the source of the leak.

item.title: Report E-2025040620
item.description:
Report E-2025040620

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver pulled a tanker out of the SJ facility while the dome lid was still partially open. This caused some of the tanker contents to spill out in the SJ Facility yard and onto the street (Berryessa Rd). SJ Technician loaded the tanker but didn't close the lid before the driver proceeded to leave the facility. SJ Technician saw liquid spilling from the tanker when the driver was still heading onto the public roadway. Another employee pulled next to the truck to advise of the leak. immediately discovered the dome lid was not closed. Dome lid was properly closed and secured. Team proceeded to report the spill and start the cleanup.

item.title: Report E-2025040561
item.description:
Report E-2025040561

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: CERES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 23, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2922 had a loose cap and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the drum lid. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the site. The crew neutralized the drum and wiped it with absorbents. The impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum after the lid was tightened for future shipment.
